channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11627] RegionSplitter's rollingSplit terminated with "/ by zero", and the _balancedSplit file was not deleted properly
item.description:
First create a table

> create 't1', 'f1'

Then split the table with util:

> bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.RegionSplitter -r -o 2 t1 UniformSplit

Finally get the following error :

12/11/08 19:21:12 DEBUG util.RegionSplitter: All regions have been successfully split!
12/11/08 19:21:12 DEBUG util.RegionSplitter: TOTAL TIME = 30sec
12/11/08 19:21:12 DEBUG util.RegionSplitter: Splits = 0
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArithmeticException: / by zero
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.RegionSplitter.rollingSplit(RegionSplitter.java:576)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.RegionSplitter.main(RegionSplitter.java:349)
item.summary: RegionSplitter's rollingSplit terminated with "/ by zero", and the _balancedSplit file was not deleted properly

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The patch works fine for me.

I think this patch will double count the finished splits when splits.verify is true.

Probably better to add a guard to the debug log message that's causing the division, especially since any exception prior to incrementing splitCount will trigger this failure.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12658925/HBASE_11627.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12658925

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.

This message is automatically generated.

Probably better to add a guard to the debug log message that's causing the division, especially since any exception prior to incrementing splitCount will trigger this failure.

+1, want to take it Sean Busbey?
Sure thing. Here's a version that only outputs the time per split if there are splits. Also uses some previously dead test code for rolling splits to verify this fix.

Thanks to Sean Busbey] for the guard code.

You said the the patch will double count the finished splits when splits.verify is true which is not right, I check the patch and find it's not possible.

And I also find another bug about the caculation of the variable splitCount which is cause by the wrong caculation of variable finished.

Until now, i think the patch v2 + v3 is ready for review.

I'm a newbie, any suggestion will be great appreciated.

louis hust, if there's also an error in the calculation of splitCount it's probably best to open that as a new ticket. A good indicator that it isn't directly related to the divide by zero is that if I apply your v3 patch and then run the test from my v2 patch (without the guard change) then the test still fails.
reattaching v2 patch as v4 (no changes) because QA bot never took a look at it.

Sean Busbey, Thanks for your help and attention. I combine your guard patch and my patch togother, named HBASE_11627-v5.patch, and I also add a new test case in the TestRegionSplitter which can reproduce the bug.

Patch HBASE_11627-v5.patch is ready for review!
